title: No ordinary backtrace when query stack is printed

labels.name: A-driver
labels.description: Area: rustc_driver that ties everything together into the `rustc` compiler

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When debugging rustc, I often want backtraces, naturally. Normally they appear fine, but sometimes, during queries, I only get the query stack printed, without the ordinary backtrace. That is, I get something like

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'encountered error with `-Z treat_err_as_bug', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:490:13
query stack during panic:
#0 [explicit_predicates_of] processing `Bar::{{impl-Trait}}`
#1 [predicates_defined_on] processing `Bar::{{impl-Trait}}`
#2 [predicates_of] processing `Bar::{{impl-Trait}}`
#3 [explicit_predicates_of] processing `Bar`
#4 [predicates_defined_on] processing `Bar`
#5 [predicates_of] processing `Bar`
#6 [typeck_tables_of] processing `a`
#7 [type_of] processing `Bar`
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
```

but not something like

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'encountered error with `-Z treat_err_as_bug', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:490:13
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
   1: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
   2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
   3: std::panicking::default_hook
   4: rustc::util::common::panic_hook
   5: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   6: std::panicking::begin_panic
   7: rustc_errors::Handler::emit_db
   8: rustc_errors::diagnostic_builder::DiagnosticBuilder::emit
   9: rustc::ty::query::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt<'a, 'gcx, 'tcx>>::emit_error
  10: <rustc::ty::sty::TyKind<'tcx> as rustc::util::ppaux::Print>::print
  11: rustc::util::ppaux::<impl core::fmt::Debug for rustc::ty::TyS<'tcx>>::fmt
  12: core::fmt::builders::DebugTuple::field
  13: <core::option::Option<T> as core::fmt::Debug>::fmt
  14: core::fmt::write
  15: <core::fmt::Arguments<'_> as core::fmt::Display>::fmt
  16: core::fmt::write
  17: env_logger::filter::Filter::matches
  18: <env_logger::Logger as log::Log>::log
  19: log::__private_api_log
  20: <(dyn rustc_typeck::astconv::AstConv<'gcx, 'tcx> + 'o)>::create_substs_for_ast_path
  21: rustc::hir::PathSegment::with_generic_args
  22: <(dyn rustc_typeck::astconv::AstConv<'gcx, 'tcx> + 'o)>::create_substs_for_ast_trait_ref
  23: <(dyn rustc_typeck::astconv::AstConv<'gcx, 'tcx> + 'o)>::instantiate_poly_trait_ref_inner
...
```

Really, I want both in such circumstances.

Note, I'm building rustc master on macOS 10.14.2.

(P.S. Is there a reason line numbers aren't printed for backtraces? At least only for the panic line, and no others?)

CC @Zoxc
